main event: Four bright lights in diamond formation were sighted at 17:45 CST on December 9, 1952, by two pilots flying in a T-33 aircraft near Madison, Wisconsin.
interesting points: The pilots chased the lights which traveled at speeds estimated around 400 mph and sometimes reached 4,000-5,000 mph., The lights were described as very bright, almost white in color., Local radar failed to pick up the unidentified objects despite tracking the aircraft., The lights maintained a constant distance apart while changing direction., The pilots reported clear visibility at the time with a ceiling of around 25,000 feet.
sighted object: four bright lights in diamond formation
witness description: pilots flying in a T-33 aircraft
